ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
1. When entering a new situation. my child expects to have fun.
Notes: 0=Not at all true of my child; 1=Not very true of my child; 2=A little true of my child; 3=very true of my child

ElementDescription: 2. My child often expects that the day will not turn out to be nice.
Notes: 0=Very true of my child; 1=A little true of my child; 2=Not very true of my child; 3=Not at all true of my child

ElementDescription: 3. Even if everything is all right. my child expects something bad to happen.
Notes: 0=Very true of my child; 1=A little true of my child; 2=Not very true of my child; 3=Not at all true of my child

ElementDescription: 4. My child often seems to anticipate disappointments.
Notes: 0=Very true of my child; 1=A little true of my child; 2=Not very true of my child; 3=Not at all true of my child

ElementDescription: 5. When my child does not know what is ahead. my child expects something pleasant.
Notes: 0=Not at all true of my child; 1=Not very true of my child; 2=A little true of my child; 3=very true of my child

ElementDescription: 6. My child expects that even the funniest play or game will end miserably.
Notes: 0=Very true of my child; 1=A little true of my child; 2=Not very true of my child; 3=Not at all true of my child

ElementDescription: 7. Even if the day begins poorly. my child expects that it will get better.
Notes: 0=Not at all true of my child; 1=Not very true of my child; 2=A little true of my child; 3=very true of my child

ElementDescription: 8. My child expects more pleasant than unpleasant things to happen to them.
Notes: 0=Not at all true of my child; 1=Not very true of my child; 2=A little true of my child; 3=very true of my child
